meanings.definition: A type of small cake or cookie, typically chocolate-covered and filled with cream or another sweet filling.
meanings.sent1: I love to eat dingdongs for dessert.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone enjoyed the tasty dingdongs.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as a dingdong.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked dingdongs filled the room.

meanings.definition: A bell that makes a ringing sound when struck.
meanings.sent1: The dingdongs on the church tower chimed every hour.
meanings.sent2: I heard the dingdongs of the ice cream truck approaching.
meanings.sent3: The musical performance ended with the sound of dingdongs.
meanings.sent4: The dingdongs echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The gentle dingdongs of wind chimes soothed her.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a dingdong and forget your keys again.
meanings.sent2: He always acts like a dingdong in front of his friends.
meanings.sent3: The comedian played the role of a lovable dingdong in the movie.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dingdong for missing the obvious solution.
meanings.sent5: His antics at the party made him the biggest dingdong of the night.
